entries.meaning: (physics) A line that is tangent to the velocity of flow of a fluid; equivalent to the path of a specific particle in that flow.
(meteorology) On a weather chart, a line that is tangent to the flow of the wind.

verbs.description: streamline (third-person singular simple present streamlines, present participle streamlining, simple past and past participle streamlined)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To design and construct the contours of a vehicle etc. so as to offer the least resistance to its flow through a fluid.
(transitive, by extension) To simplify or organize a process in order to increase its efficiency.
